results.title: A Matter of Chance Episode 1
results.brief_description: One of a series which looks at the problems and aspirations of the disabled. Episode 1 concerns the plight of a three year old boy who has severe brain damage caused by a malformation of the brain, and the struggle of his parents to find a future for their son

results.title: A Man and an organ
results.creator_credit: John Bushelle, Peter Johnson and Film Australia
results.brief_description: A filmic insight into Ronald Sharp - the self-taught builder of the Grand Organ in the Sydney Opera House. No Australian building has caught the imagination of the world as much as the Sydney Opera House. Opened in 1973 by Her Majesty, Queen Elizabeth II, it was always intended that the main concert hall of this performing arts miracle building should have as its dominant, centre-stage focus a magnificent organ that would rival the splendour of the instrument in the Sydney Town Hall, the city’s biggest recital organ.

results.title: A Man's hands
results.brief_description: A witty and fast-cut montage dramatising the activities of the human hand: squeezing, poking, fixing, scratching, zipping, playing and touching. Alternatively funny and moving, entertaining and informative.

results.title: A Matter of life and death
results.creator_credit: Emeric Pressburger, Michael Powell, Independent Producers and Archers Film Productions
results.brief_description: Squadron Leader Peter Carter (David Niven), is caught between two worlds, reality, and the other which exists in his imagination that has been contaminated by war. As his plane travels over the English Channel in a ball of fire, he prepares to jump without a parachute. In what he believes are his final moments he shares his feelings on love and poetry with an American WAC, Kim Hunter. After he lands ashore he meets the WAC and they fall in love. All seems well, but a case of concussion causes Carter to experience hallucinations in which he finds himself on trial within his imaginary world. This film also features Raymond Massey, Roger Livesey and Richard Attenbourough. Also known as “Stairway to heaven”. Earthbound sequences are filmed in technicolour and Heaven sequences in black and white.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Emeric Pressburger, Michael Powell, Independent Producers and Archers Film Productions

results.title: A Matter of fat
results.creator_credit: William Weintraub, Desmond Dew and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A rather astonishing film showing how one man shed nearly half his body weight - 63 kg of it (140 pounds) - by complete starvation under hospital observation. What brought him to so desperate a course, and how he managed to cope with it, is told with candor and humor by the fat man himself. Lorne Greene narrates the rest. Between times, the film leaves Gilles Lorrain and his lonely struggle to examine what other overweight people are doing, singly or in groups, to reduce to more normal proportions. Medical authorities comment on some misconceptions and malpractices of the slimming industry. Narrated by Lorne Green. (Awards: Toronto; New York; Atlanta)

results.title: A Matter of attitude: older people confronting the fear of frailty
results.brief_description: Introduced by Ruth Cracknell, this program interviews five older Australians who are prime examples of how life can be exciting and fulfilling - even if you happen to be frail. They each have their own life experiences to recount, but they are united by their ability to set achievable goals for activity levels; focus on capabilities rather than the things they can’t do; and a willingness to seek help for everyday activities if they can’t perform them independently. Produced by ABC Television (Queensland) in collaboration with the Office of Ageing in the Department of Families, Youth and Community Care, Queensland.

results.title: A Man for all seasons
results.brief_description: Robert Bolt’s literate and penetrating treatment of the conflict waged between Sir Thomas More and King Henry VIII makes a smooth transition to the screen. Zinnemann has mounted a film with an eye for characterisation rather than spectacle and the result is a superior drama. Stars Paul Scofield, Robert Shaw, Wendy Hiller, Orson Welles, Susannah York and Vanessa Redgrave. Rated: G

results.title: A Man called Sledge
results.creator_credit: Vic Morrow, Dino De Laurentiis and De Laurentiis Entertainment Group
results.brief_description: Outlaw Luther Sledge (James Garner) sets out with his bandit gang to steal a half million dollar consignment of gold bullion which is shipped each week through a small western town. His scheme involves stealing the gold from within a local prison where it is held overnight. This daring escapade leads to a sequence of betrayals and a violent trail of vengeance across the Mexican border. This is a dramatic and fast-moving western which casts James Garner in the unusual role of villain, the supporting cast includes Dennis Weaver, Claude Akins and John Marley.

results.title: A Loving pinch = Cubit cubitan
results.creator_credit: Maman Firmansjah, Sabirin Kasdani and Rapi Films
results.brief_description: An example of a dangdut musical drama made popular in its time mostly by Indian filmmakers. The dangdut form of music/culture entertainment is a favourite amongst working-class Indonesians, mostly men who traditionally come from a hard day’s work to relax to the music and gyrating hips of the singers. The film features established dangdut star, Elvy Sukaesih, as a mother who comes to Jakarta with her two children to look for her husband, only to find he has eloped with another woman. Separated from her children when the place they are staying for the night catches fire, Elvy becomes a star by sheer luck and is later reunited with her children. While this has been going on her husband has lost his job and is thrown out of his own house by the other woman. Cast includes Elvy Sukaesih, Santi Sardi and Lukman Sardi. In Indonesian with English subtitles.

results.title: A Look at parliament
results.creator_credit: R. Barrington Scott and State Film Centre of Victoria
results.brief_description: Opening with the traditional swearing-in ceremony of the Governor of Victoria (Sir henry Winneke) this film briefly surveys the historic beginnings of the Victorian Parliament, including its architecture and design. From there it shows procedures relating to Victoria’s 46th Parliament. The work of the Governor, Legislative Assembly and Council, various committees and Officers of Parliament is viewed and there is a glimpse of the Parliamentary library.
